ecic-overview:
EC/IC Process Flow Overview

This SharePoint page provides a comprehensive overview of the External/Internal Connections (EC/IC) process for IT assets. The process varies by asset type to ensure appropriate security controls.

Process Overview

  1. Asset Type Identification: Classify your asset and review type-specific requirements
  2. Security Assessment: Complete the appropriate security questionnaire
  3. Technical Documentation: Prepare network diagrams and technical specifications
  4. Risk Assessment: Security team evaluates potential risks and mitigations
  5. Approval & Implementation: Deploy with proper monitoring and controls

Asset Type Workflows

  • End-User Device EC/IC Workflow
  • Server EC/IC Workflow
  • Network Equipment EC/IC Workflow

Access the EC/IC Process Diagram for a visual guide.

security-guidelines:
Security Guidelines Overview

General security guidelines for establishing external and internal connections. Specific requirements vary by asset type.

Universal Security Principles

  • Principle of Least Privilege: Grant minimum necessary access
  • Defense in Depth: Implement multiple security layers
  • Continuous Monitoring: Monitor all connections and activities
  • Regular Review: Periodic assessment of access and connections

end-user-device-workflow:
End-User Device EC/IC Workflow

Specific workflow and requirements for onboarding end-user devices including laptops, workstations, tablets, and mobile devices.

Workflow Steps

  1. Device Registration: Register device in asset management system
  2. Security Configuration: Apply security baseline and policies
  3. Network Access: Configure network access and VPN settings
  4. User Training: Provide security awareness training
  5. Monitoring Setup: Enable endpoint detection and response

Required Information

  • Device Details: Make, model, serial number, operating system
  • User Information: Primary user, department, role
  • Use Case: Primary business function and data access requirements
  • Network Requirements: Connectivity needs and locations

Security Considerations

  • Endpoint Protection: Antivirus and anti-malware solutions
  • Data Loss Prevention: Controls to prevent data exfiltration
  • Remote Access: VPN and secure remote access capabilities
  • Mobile Device Management: Enrollment in MDM for mobile devices
server-workflow:
Server EC/IC Workflow

Specific workflow and requirements for onboarding servers including application servers, database servers, web servers, and infrastructure services.

Workflow Steps

  1. Architecture Review: Review server architecture and dependencies
  2. Security Hardening: Apply security baseline and hardening standards
  3. Network Configuration: Configure network zones and firewall rules
  4. Access Control Setup: Implement authentication and authorization
  5. Monitoring Integration: Connect to security monitoring systems

Required Information

  • Server Specifications: Hardware, OS, applications, and services
  • Network Requirements: IP addressing, ports, protocols, and zones
  • Data Classification: Types of data processed and stored
  • Business Impact: Criticality and availability requirements

Security Considerations

  • Patch Management: Regular security updates and vulnerability management
  • Configuration Management: Standardized configurations and change control
  • Backup and Recovery: Data protection and business continuity
  • Compliance: Regulatory requirements and audit trails
network-equipment-workflow:
Network Equipment EC/IC Workflow

Specific workflow and requirements for onboarding network equipment including switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, and wireless access points.

Workflow Steps

  1. Network Design Review: Validate network topology and integration
  2. Security Configuration: Apply security templates and standards
  3. Management Setup: Configure management interfaces and access
  4. Monitoring Integration: Connect to network monitoring systems
  5. Testing and Validation: Verify functionality and security controls

Required Information

  • Equipment Details: Vendor, model, firmware version, and capabilities
  • Network Integration: Physical and logical connectivity requirements
  • Management Access: Administrative interfaces and protocols
  • Traffic Patterns: Expected traffic flows and performance requirements

Security Considerations

  • Firmware Management: Regular updates and vulnerability patching
  • Configuration Security: Secure default settings and hardening
  • Access Control: Role-based access and strong authentication
  • Network Segmentation: Proper VLAN and routing policies
